conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_B and I’m applying because School_A is my first-choice school. I’m strongly motivated to join your community and would accept immediately if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately to maximize the chance of getting my highest true preference. Although School_A ranks me 4th in its priority list and capacity is 1 (so acceptance is unlikely if higher-priority students apply), delaying would only reduce my chances further. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. After reviewing our current priorities and anticipated applicant pool for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority order: E > D > A > B > C. Student_B is applying and ranks School_A first, but B is only 4th on our list. In the broader market, Student_E ranks School_A 3rd, Student_D ranks School_A 3rd, Student_A ranks School_A 3rd, and Student_C ranks School_A last—so higher-priority candidates may not apply to us immediately, but they could if rejected elsewhere. Accepting B now would lock our only seat and prevent matching with E/D/A if they later apply. Since it's only round 1 (early), it is strategically better to reject B and preserve capacity to pursue higher-priority students.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_B is my first-choice school because I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I’m ready to contribute actively to the school community. I would be honored to attend if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C), waiting would only reduce my chances if higher-priority students apply first. conversation.message:

Also, Student_E (our top choice) currently ranks School_B last, so unlikely to apply soon; Student_B ranks School_B second and may apply to School_A first. To maximize our outcome, we should reserve the seat for Student_C rather than accept Student_D now. Therefore, reject D this round.

Among these, C is the highest on my list (C outranks D and A). Although E and B are ranked above C, neither has applied to me this round, and delaying risks losing a strong feasible match because C is applying now and would accept. Given the protocol allows only one response per student per round and a match is finalized upon ACCEPT, the best way to maximize my outcome within quota given current offers is to accept Student_C now rather than reject and hope for E/B later.
